tr.td: NEW PROBLEM Right shoulder pain times 2 years

DISCUSSION AND PLAN: X-ray at this time demonstrates prominence or hypertrophy of the AC joint. I am recommending a subacromial cortisone injection from which he will certainly watch his blood sugars for fluctuation and a home exercise program. We will set him up for a cervical spine MRI and evaluation with Dr. Sabatino, but he will also refer him to Dr. Gennis for evaluation for his distal upper extremity complaints.
KTP

text.paragraph: Patient educational handouts: No information available.

td.content: Kaylee, MD: 981 Rios Bypass Suite 970, South Tracy, MA 04341, Ph. (+1-8292161926

text.paragraph:
Note:
We are seeing Anthony today who is presenting for evaluation of right shoulder pain that has been bothering him for a couple of years. He denies any injury. He states it is really painful at the top of the shoulder. He tries to sleep with his arm out extended but has been very uncomfortable and near impossible for him to do so due to the localized pain. He also states he has had some pain radiating up towards his neck and also down his arm. He has had previous upper extremity surgery involving carpal tunnel and cubital tunnel. He is complaining of multiple issues regarding residual problems and recurring problems with regards to his distal extremity procedures that were a few years ago up in New Hampshire. He reports occasional trigger fingers as well as neuropathy. He is an insulin-dependent diabetic and reports his blood sugars have been under good control on insulin.

tr.td: Constitutional: no fever, no night sweats, no significant weight gain, no significant weight loss, no chills
Cardiovascular: no chest pain, no shortness of breath when walking
Gastrointestinal: no vomiting, normal appetite, no diarrhea, no constipation, no nausea
Neurologic: no loss of consciousness, no seizures, no headache
Psych: no depression, no alcohol abuse
General Appearance: healthy-appearing, normal body habitus, NAD
Orientation: oriented to time, oriented to place, oriented to person. Mood and Affect: active and alert, normal mood, normal affect
Arterial Pulses Right: radial normal. Edema Right: none
Active Range of Motion: Normal active Cervical spine Range of Motion. Passive Range of Motion: Normal passive Cervical Spine Range of Motion, active=passive rom

Inspection Right: no scapular winging, no atrophy, AC prominence normal, no erythema, no swelling, no warmth. Bony Palpation Right: tenderness of the acromial, tenderness of the greater tuberosity. Soft Tissue Palpation Right: tenderness of the supraspinatus. Active Range of Motion Right: normal in all planes. Passive Range of Motion Right: normal. Special Tests Right: Drop arm test negative, subscapularis tests normal, Yergason's test negative, Impingement test positive, O'Brien's test positive. Stability Right: No glenohumeral instabiltiy, No AC joint instability. Strength Right: Shoulder stength 5/5 in all planes
Biceps Reflex Right: normal (2). Brachioradialis Reflex Right: normal (2). Triceps Reflex Right: normal (2). Sensation on the Right: C5 normal, C6 normal, C7 normal, C8 normal, T1 normal, T2 normal
